--- title: L1 Nerve Root (L1) --- ![Nerve roots extending from the spinal cord @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Neurology/image796 A portion of the spinal cord, showing its right lateral surface. The dura is opened and arranged to show the nerve roots.gif){#fig-gray1918-image796} # Peripheral Nerve Supply | Nerve | Roots | Motor Innervation | Cutaneous Innervation | |-|-|-|-| | [Ilioinguinal N.]({{< var ref-ilioinguinal-nerve.path >}}) | {{< var ref-ilioinguinal-nerve.roots >}} | {{< var ref-ilioinguinal-nerve.motor >}} | {{< var ref-ilioinguinal-nerve.cutaneous >}} | | [Iliohypogastric N.]({{< var ref-iliohypogastric-nerve.path >}}) | {{< var ref-iliohypogastric-nerve.roots >}} | {{< var ref-iliohypogastric-nerve.motor >}} | {{< var ref-iliohypogastric-nerve.cutaneous >}} | | [Genitofemoral N.]({{< var ref-genitofemoral-nerve.path >}}) | {{< var ref-genitofemoral-nerve.roots >}} | {{< var ref-genitofemoral-nerve.motor >}} | {{< var ref-genitofemoral-nerve.cutaneous >}} | : Peripheral Nerves Originating from L1 Nerve root {.striped .hover} # Motor Innervation ::: {#tbl-l1-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Iliocostalis cervicis Ribs 3-7 C4-C6 TP Spinal nn. Posterior rami (lateral br.)
C8 - L1		 Bilateral: Extends spine
Unilateral: Spine ipsilateral sidebend

Iliac crest
Thoracolumbar fascia (posterior layer)		 Ribs 6-12
Upper lumbar TP
Thoracolumbar fascia (posterior layer)		 Spinal nn. Posterior rami (lateral br.)
C8 - L1		 Bilateral: Extends spine
Unilateral: Spine ipsilateral sidebend
Iliocostalis thoracis Ribs 7-12 Ribs 1-6 Spinal nn. Posterior rami (lateral br.)
C8 - L1		 Bilateral: Extends spine
Unilateral: Spine ipsilateral sidebend
Psoas Major T12-L4 and associated IV discs
L1-L5 TP		 Lesser Trochanter Lumbar Plexus Direct Br.
L1 - L3		 Hip: Flexion, ER
L/S (unilateral contraction with femur fixed): I/L spine sidebend
L/S (bilateral contraction): Raises trunk from supine position
Psoas Minor T12, L1 vertebrae (lateral aspect) and IVD Pectineal Line
Iliopubic ramus
Iliac fascia
Inguinal ligament		 Spinal nn.
L1 - L3		 Trunk: Weak flexion

Ventral aspect.gif){#fig-gray1918-image797} ::: ::: {.column} ![Dermatomal cutaneous distribution (Posterior) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Neurology/image798 Distribution of cutaneous nerves. Dorsal aspect.gif){#fig-gray1918-image798} ::: ::: # Compression Compression of L3 nerve root includes: - Pain in the middle lumbar spine, upper buttock, whole anterior thigh and knee, medial knee, and just above the ankle @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 - Dural signs of prone knee flexion - SLR will occassionally be positive @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 - ↓ Extension ROM - Weakness - Slight weakness of iliopsoas @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 - Gross loss of quadriceps strength @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 - Hypoesthesia of the medial aspect of the knee and lower leg @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 - Patellar reflex Absent (0) or reduced (1)
